newsitem.title: ALBANIA: Police swarm over Tirana, prevent protests.
newsitem.headline: Police swarm over Tirana, prevent protests.

text.p: Hundreds of riot police swarmed throughout the centre of Tirana on Wednesday to prevent Albania's opposition parties from staging fresh anti-government protests.

Two truckloads of police descended on the headquarters of the Forum for Democracy opposition alliance and prevented prominent politicians, including Socialist party chief Rexhep Mejdani, from leaving the building.

Bystanders, mainly elderly women, shouted at policemen: "We will turn this into a Vlore" -- a reference to the southern port where three people have died this week in clashes between anti-government protesters and police.

Vans loaded with khaki-clad riot police circulated slowly throughout the capital's centre. Anyone pausing near central Skanderbeg Square, where protesters failed to stage a rally last weekend, were ushered away.
The Forum had called for a midday protest at Tirana's main stadium, but the Interior Ministry banned the gathering.
Prime Minister Aleksander Meksi has vowed to crack down on a wave of protests by angry investors left destitute by the collapse of pyramid investment schemes.
